page.title: 05Boat Building in Norham
page.content: Boats built by Simpsons of Norham are 14 Feet 6 inches long, and 4 Feet 9 Inches wide. Originally all raw materials were provided locally, but prices are no longer competitive and wood is brought in from other parts of the country. In recent years the number of boats being commissioned has declined due to the increasing use of Fibre- glass boats, the high price of wood, and the general decline of the net salmon fishing in the area. This is especially true in the case of the salmon coble, as one hasn't been built in Norham in over 4 years. The Simpsons, masters of their craft, create a boat without referring to any plans and use only a couple of cross-sectional templates. Their boats are unique in design and quality.
